titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Vintage Equipment Collection RG.011
titlestmt.author: Lindsay Anderberg

publicationstmt.publisher: Poly Archives at the Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology, NYU Libraries

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-02-06 17:39:21 -0500.

change.item: Finding aid revised and edited by Zoe Blecher-Cohen, Mandy Abokhair, and Aileen Thong in 2021 to update the institutional change from NYU-Poly to NYU and for compliance with DACS Required Elements for Archival Description.

repository.corpname: Poly Archives at the Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology, NYU Libraries

did.unittitle: Vintage Equipment Collection
did.abstract: The items in this collection relate to the fields of electrical and civil engineering, as well as supplemental equipment, and were used by engineers in the early to mid 20th century.
did.physloc: Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology 5 MetroTech Center Brooklyn, New York, 11201 (646) 997-3943 polyarchives@nyu.edu

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The items in this collection were transferred to the Poly Archives by various university departments. The most prominently represented departments include Civil Engineering and Electrical Engineering.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Equipment in this collection includes items civil and electrical engineers would have used in the early to mid 20th century. Surveying equipment, such as a theodolite and transit, as well as electrical engineering instruments, such as a decade capacitor, decade resistor, potentiometer, and volt meter are included. The equipment ranges in date from the early to mid 20th century.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Items in this collection are arranged alphabetically.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is currently on display in the Bern Dibner Reading Room of the Bern Dibner Library of Science & Technology.
Please contact the archives to view items in this collection.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish materials must be obtained from:
Poly Archives & Special Collections Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology 5 MetroTech Center Brooklyn, NY 11201

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Vintage Equipment Collection; RG 011; box number; folder number or item identifier; Poly Archives at Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology, New York University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials found in collection; there is no documentation concerning the provenance of these materials.

did.physloc: Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology 5 MetroTech Center Brooklyn, New York, 11201 (646) 997-3943 polyarchives@nyu.edu

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: These items were donated to the Poly Archives by Frank Baranowski's daughter, Susan Baranowski in February 2021. Accession 20-001.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This donation is housed in two boxes and arranged into two sub-series: Sub-series A: Engineering Equipment, circa 1930-1965 and Sub-series B: Academia, 1954. Items are listed alphabetically.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Frank Baranowksi was born on November 1, 1921 in Bayonne, New Jersey and received a BS in Chemical Engineering from New York University Heights on June 5, 1943 and an MS from the University of Tennessee. Baranowski was a World War II vet and an engineer on the Manhattan Project. He passed away in Williamsburg, Virginia on August 30, 2017.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These items mainly include engineering equipment such as slide rules, drafting tools, and scales from the 1930s-1960s. They are located in bay 29 shelf 4C.
